intro: Conimitella, commonly known as the "false cactus," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems that store water, typical of arid environments. The plants produce showy, often brightly colored flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Conimitella species are native to regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Argentina. They are adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions and are often found in rocky or sandy soils.
